qsnCIrjnyXb1ZOjAuq2Rtg.text: Food-horrible. Service-horrible.  Beer selection-amazing.   That's all I can really say. Sitting at the bar was a rare experience. A bartender would literally ask us how we were doing and walk away before we could even answer. People around us were literally leaving because they weren't receiving service. We left after 2 rounds because of the garbage service. I had my usual bourbon on the rocks and Andy had  a vanilla porter beer that was good.   ... Food - 1 star. Luke warm sausage, with build your own condiments that came out of plastic packages. Gross. Never again will we return. We will stick to sake rok.

-JHlblWNTT0dBEhaXlWiMw.text: The wings were to die for. Fries were a little salty for my taste but still pretty good. Lot of different beers to choose from. Also seemed like it was a place for the locals to watch Golden Knight's games. Cool atmosphere. Would definitely check it out again on my next visit to Vegas.

IMGfXV3psDu7-4qQ76qC8g.text: Food: We did not end up having food here, but the beer selection was good.  Some local NV beers are available. Rating: Three stars.  Service: The happy hour was widely advertised, but not actually available.  The way that the staff handled this was less than ideal since the staff should have immediately taken the signs outside. Rating: One star  Atmosphere: This is a fun place to watch sporting events on TV. Rating: Five stars  Location: The location on The Strip is great. Rating: Five stars

YsF0ryRAmwcRsB9nmlxvHg.text: I went to a VGK game last week and decided to check this place out before we headed to the arena. The atmosphere was energetic and the bar was packed! Luckily we found some seats and ordered a couple of drinks.  They have a great selection of craft beers (which is my personal favorite) Our bartender Jeff was very attentive and on top of our drinks. We missed the 1st quarter of the game cause we were having such a great time. We didn't really mind because they broadcasted the game at the bar. Overall a fun experience and we will definitely be returning soon.

GzUHw1PT2P_OQlecDGj0Ew.text: Had the vegetarian burger which is a quinoa patty. Surprisingly good. Came with nice romaine lettuces and pickles and onions . There's even some arugula on this. Came with a small side of pickled veggies. Everything tastes really fresh and made to order. Had to order a side of fried dill pickle spears since I've never had them. Pleasantly surprised- fried just right with nice batter.  The guy at the register was really nice and helpful since this was my first time here. I'm not a beer drinker but looks like they have quite a selection.  I'm liking this semi healthy meal

lCQ5orAYS9kjT0DiMfmkrg.text: Beerhaus was definitely one of my favorite spots while exploring Vegas! It's a very chill venue with plenty of indoor and outdoor seating for small or large groups.  There are also seats at the bar that have charging stations just in case your phone is about to die.  The employees that work here are awesome and make the experience even better! Beerhaus has some local brews from the area that are brilliant! I remember having one that was a stout and it was so good that I had to get a second! And for being on the strip the prices out here are amazing! There are ton of board games inside, and games outside such as giant jenga.  I'd also recommend this spot if you're trying to catch a game too... numerous TVs are located throughout the bar.  This is a really fun spot to hangout with friends whether you're looking to have a chill night, kill some time, or just to grab a quick brew.  Will definitely come back if I happen to be back in Vegas soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Solid oatmeal style stout local brew
Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front

FXu15ZGcv2rISNxZcoA-eg.text: Great beer selection and pretty decent food. The woman who took our order messed it up. We went back to correct it and she messed it up again. We went up a third time and said it was too late to change the order so we were stuck with the wrong order. Not very friendly, service. Otherwise nice place.

qt8-rGCu30-h_kbyBe1zYQ.text: Disappointing service.  Expected more customer service being so close to the tmobile arena.

5tvLum4s3Y4XFvk0s4V9pQ.text: Way overpriced for a bar you have to get your own food from. Cool atmosphere but charging $18 for literally 2 shots of vodka? Come on.

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $18 and 20 minutes for a fairly crappy martini. Won&#39;t be back.

QE4iBCTWuouvW0f0DmDX-A.text: We went here to catch a football game and grab some food. It's a big, open and airy (literally open to outside on one entire side) space.   I'd say it's mostly a bar with food. They have a few sandwich, sausage, and BBQ options that you order up at the side counter and then get a buzzer that lets you know when it's ready. (my recommendation: fries with beer cheese...I wanted to drink that stuff!) They have a decent draft and bottle list, including some local brews.   There are a lot of table options and a large square bar in the center of the space. What they also have is a lot of games... nearly every table will at least have jenga, but in the back they have shuffleboard, ping pong and table soccer.   It's located right outside the T-Mobile Arena so great place to get some drinks before an event.

cWLzKBZ4Q-Jy4kMHvAJ5Tg.text: 8/9/16 Okay, I need to get this out of the way, I love this place!! I enjoyed how chill it was for being on the Strip of all places; it was like being back in NYC (Where I'm from) because we have a bunch of cool chill spots such as this. There are games inside, and the drink menu is pretty awesome too!

udPWD4oj5adGp5S5Z2Ztgg.text: This beerhaus is located in a great spot, has a lot to offer if you can get service.  The bartenders are more concerned with talking to each other than providing any type of customer service. And don't ask Jacyln for a happy menu.. she will toss it at you. I went on a non Golden Knight game night and you have to wait 7 minutes for them to acknowledge you or even offer you a drink.

aJtM4WSANw7WFxya-CulxA.text: This casual place has fun games - Lincoln logs, connect four, jenga - in a low key atmosphere. Rustic vibes. I highly recommend the vegetarian burger. I'm not a vegetarian, but it was delicious! Would definitly recommend for a quick bite outside of the chaos of the strip!

3kYWvO9AkVfQ3kUI0TPgzg.text: Being locals, we typically try to avoid the strip, but when we do come we have our go-to spots!  We stumbled upon Beerhaus before a concert at T-Mobile. Great selection of craft and local brews with pretty decent happy hour prices. Since then we've followed suit for the last three events we've been to. Throw on a brat and pretzels with beer cheese and your pregame meal is complete!  We typically have them cut the brat in half and we split it along with the pretzels. Just enough to soak up the brews before heading into T-Mobile without feeling too stuffed (don't forget your roadie for the walk down). The prices are GREAT considering you're on the strip which makes it a bonus! We've been known to have four rounds and grub for under $50. You just have to be open minded to whatever is on happy hour ($4 craft beers).   Now, the ambiance is on point. Love the beer garden feel with the outside patio tables. We've even been known to come down on a beautiful day with the kids. They're entertained with Jenga, connect four, ping pong and cornhole while mommy and daddy enjoy a frosty. There are always other kids to play with too which is a perk!   Overall, this is a great spot for all ages. I wouldn't say to bring your kids on a Saturday night (you wouldn't find any others there anyway), but for a day time pit spot, a cheap spot before T-Mobile, or even just a place to stop and rest during your haul up and down the strip, Beerhaus is worth the visit!

D4rIZYne0pmHGiP1AerYvQ.text: My boyfriend and I came in after a Zumanity show  and had an awesome server named Chrya! She offered me the golden road hefeweizen because I explained the type of beers I enjoy, she even said she has some at home! It was delicious! She brought over 2 shots of beer for us to try and called it a random act of kindness, which is very unheard of on the Las Vegas Strip! There were also a bunch of games to play to keep us entertained. It was a perfect end of our date night we will be back again!

3teYvDPZ5FuIOT_oxadVRg.text: Went here a couple nights ago for drinks before a work event. Sat at a high top bar, friendly and attentive service, but I would only go here if I was in the area. On nights where there's an event at the T-Mobile arena, there's no happy hour.. Which is fine with me but that means there's no happy hour a lot of the times! They have a wide selection of beers, which they should since it is called beerhaus. What I liked about the place was that they had hard liquor as well. Most beer places do not serve hard liquor so if you're going in a group you can't really cater to everyone's needs or if you want a kick to your drink they'll have it! Overall, this is a great place to meet friends or to grab a drink. Do expect to pay strip prices though for your drinks. And make sure you carefully read how many ounces of beer you're getting for the one you're ordering because at this place, it varies a lot!

zwlzIHJIxMCOHzTiWXB0AA.text: This is a cool little spot to grab a quick bite and a drinks. Open concept in Las Vegas is nice. Great pretzels, fries with beer cheese

8CriwOsRCv85RRYRacVLMg.text: You have to go up and order your food from the "eats" counter but then someone will deliver your food to your seat when it's ready...the Beerhaus brat was my favorite!!!

1VTzYwZ_2pqAhLo8Kanu2Q.text: Wow!  Very cool place, and huge craft beer selection.  We also had a German style brat that was awesome.  The place was so new it didn't even have a check in!  Several of the servers were altogether cool and pleasant.  They have a ping pong table, that bar type shuffle board....and games like Jenga.  People were enjoying those.  We will for sure and hit this again before T-Mobile Arena concerts or just in town for Vegas fun.

ETemQBFJNiox1F-E6VvSug.text: As a local I love going to Beerhaus because it feels like a fun escape from the Strip! They have one of the best beer selections in town and amazing bites if you're hungry. The best part about Beerhaus is the fun atmosphere! There are games to play and live music. Definitely recommend for a fun, casual night out!

y5Jm6QCJd-z4hzrZZBmzMA.text: Was in Las Vegas, working our way down the strip and found the BeerHaus. Just finding a sports bar where I could sit a while and watch the NCAA games was nice but they have a very nice selection of beers and I liked we could order a hot dog to go with it. The highlight though, was our server Katie. She knew about the different types of beer and made suggestions based on what we normally drank. She also knew the history for some of the different brews which was interesting and entertaining. The place is good sized with out door seating and it looked like Katie was taking care of half the tables herself but she stopped by regularly to see if anything was needed, always smiling and happy. In a town based on service, she should be the poster person. Overall, great experience. Excellent beer, good food, nice setting and great service.

r7UqBN3q4fFYD8pqBrReOA.text: Great ambiance, great food, great staff. We will eat here again before we leave!  We had the fried pickles, fries w beer cheese, and brats. Fun place!

HiquipD7urhRM8vPbkLAXg.text: Very poor customer service!!!  Went in due to special posted on strip to be told it was not offered event days!!!  The sign says nothing about event days.  We left as I was not up for paying 18 bucks for a hot dog and a beer.  Crazy manager chased us down while we were in line at another restaurant to show us the exception is on the menu.  What a stalker!!!  Still not on the sign you idiot!

kNXx3dfryI0-1Vz9N8vU2Q.text: Lets start by saying the atmosphere is awesome; tables spread out in various different forms from a beer garden style, to booths, to bar stools. There are also plenty of different types of games you can play too if you bring others with you. (ex: connect 4, jenga, and other board games along with larger ones towards the back). Time to get to the food and service overall. The food? GREAT! had the brat along with a pretzel and fries. Prices (food wise) are not too bad, and theyre not small portions either. Now to the drinks! this IS a beerhaus right? Why yes it is but you have to remember its also on the strip so this is where they can get you on the $$. Paid about $8 a beer, mainly German hefeweizens. Lets just say that I typically pay around $9 for an entire 6 pack (same brand too). There are PLENTY of other beers on the menu, in fact the selection is huge, but if I'm going to a "beerhaus" I'm not going to have a plain $3 bud light. I want a real beer for a good price.  Like I said, this place is on the strip so they're going to get people paying for whatever no matter what. The service was ok. Very slow and took about 15 mins just to get the tab but it also looked like she was the only one working on a busy afternoon. I Kind of felt bad for the girl. Lets just say this: if you're on the strip definitely check it out, if you're a local and have no reason for going to the strip then don't.

HKVa0IOM8kzUG0AjwlgdXg.text: Horrible service!! The place was half empty and I still waited 15 minutes for the waitress. After we placed the order we waited another 10 minutes for 4 drinks. Two out of my three beer selections were on the menu but not available at the time. This place needs some time to operate properly.

JbgqsYeAidxHV8YuEaDjOQ.text: marlo is an awesome server! serve is awesome, took the time to help us find the right beer!  great place to hang out.  server, marlo made the visit great!

agHkcZIr0yQ3qFNfDEDxSw.text: We stumbled into Beerhaus yesterday to kill some time before our dinner reservation. We sat at the bar where this babe of a bartender, Courtney, greeted us with a plethora of knowledge of the beers they had! After sampling her recommendations, we all ordered a few happy hour rounds and people watched. The atmosphere is super fun and light, lots of bar games and freaking great service! We'll be re-visiting on our next stumble through The Park.

DDPCOVXtqVXXi8tDWyZUNw.text: Great beer selection.   Laid back atmosphere and the great service from Chelsea was unforgettable! Thanks love!

fmDct_aQYaKd34PBojFsxw.text: I love this place. Great beer selection and a wonderful staff. Kimmi was the best bartender I've ever had.

SV4_EwH-RK3UbPU-Y2AeGA.text: I was in Las Vegas over Christmas and decided to stop in since I had never been there before. I sat at the bar and the bartenders were very friendly and gave me some good suggestions, I live on the east coast and most of the beers they have don't make it out this way. I usually go to Vegas twice a year, Beerhaus will definitely become a regular stop.

F-ehhUTWW-pSBm3oY2nepQ.text: The Beerhaus is the newest, hippest place on the strip. Whether it's the giant jenga or any of the other table games, or the myriad of TV screens showing your favorite game, there's always something to see and do while enjoying your favorite brew or tasting something new. If you get hungry you can run over to their ticket booth/food window and order up your favorite pub food or snack. Though this concept is still lost on most people, once you get the hang of it it's not a bad idea at all-after all folks, it's a drinking place! As this concept is new to Vegas, so is the concept of great service to the staff and management. Each time we've gone we've had slow service, the servers seem overwhelmed even when the place is not at capacity but, I have hope that eventually management will figure out the winning formula to make everything work. The last time we visited I spent the night correcting our server on the status of our bill and even turned her back when she brought us drinks we didn't order. The prices are what you would expect for craft beer on the strip though domestic beer prices seem tolerable. if you have a favorite domestic beer you enjoy, maybe its best to stick with that thru the night otherwise you're going to experience sticker shock with each round of especially brewed craft beer you order. When there's a band playing, the environment picks up as most people like to request their favorite tune, adding to the already positive vibe of the place. As I am not a local I can't speak to the pain locals feel paying the astronomical parking fees on event nights at the T-Mobile arena. I imagine this might steer locals to their favorite watering hole away from the strip on these nights, this too has to have a solution sometime in the near future. In the long run I believe Beerhaus will become one of the favorite drinking joints on the strip, Cheers!

4uiYGMTL-MSD-YZaCJq9-g.text: Slow service when the bar is completely empty, and the prices are high for the bartenders not knowing how to make basic drinks.

Sal2U8k5ADyBy79xu4UXuw.text: To start the happy hour food was great at a great price. When I'm in Vegas I'm on vacation, so I don't worry about prices. But that's a good deal if you lost all your money and need cheap eats! We were here on a Monday afternoon, so it was not busy at all. We walked up to the bar. The bartender didn't show up for at least 5 minutes. We asked for a beer menu. Another 5 minutes goes by and she's nowhere to be found. Our friends grabbed a table and a server came over. So we decided to just order from her instead. I'm not sure what the bartender was doing? Even when she gave us the menus she seemed unhappy to be there. Maybe she was just having a dad day? Our server was pretty nice though. At least she was willing to get us drinks. The servers don't bring you food. You have to order at a window and then get it yourself when it's done. They give you a pager. When it came time to close our tab it was extremely confusing. It has a ticket price AND a total? Makes no sense. We asked the server to explain and she herself couldn't even explain it. Hopefully they are still working out the kinks on this system. It's similar to Beer Park at Paris with the games at tables. But their beer selection is not as good. I was hoping for a cider type beer or something more summer-like. But they really didn't have much of that. I ordered an old fashioned which was on their cocktail menu. I'm from Wisconsin so I should have known better than to order that in Vegas. But, I figured it would be good if it's on their menu? It was awful! Nothing close to what it should be. But the strawberry Mojito was excellent!

Kp8lLSJFby-TapjJQ-6C_A.text: Understaffed for big events. I was there for The Killers show (1st show at the new T-Mobile arena) and wanted a beer. Stood at the bar for about 10-15 min. and there was only one bartender on my side. She was doing the best she could but couldn't handle the large crowd. I just decided to leave since no one was around to take my order. Waste of time.

rhnsRF_PrVIKL0suDa1JDg.text: As a local I would not come back.  Can deal with get your own food, but the service was terrible.  The staff do not seem to be in it for the long haul and know tourist don't come back.  Its a shame as the venue is cool.

ydLHE8IOnqV3Fdo_GbYobQ.text: If I could I would give this place  zero stars. The spit roasted pork was terrible. Tasted like boiled pork butt with sauteed onions. Service terrible unfriendly waitress. Only this good thing  was the draft beer, sin city amber. If you complain the the management a person by the name of Rupert. You will only get and pre rehearsed response. Totally unacceptable. For the money you can get a lot better food and service elsewhere. There are so many options nearby.

1KUItfncpu0cXAQmuCsM-Q.text: Really cool spot to see great bands play! They have vegan items on the menu and a huge beer list with beer from all over the world. Friendly staff and management and a really great location with a unique motif. Lots of board games and its kid friendly!

260hfpfxzAPZUs8LpeXkVQ.text: Definitely strange to have to wade through people to order when you are sitting at the bar and the menu has food on it and they cannot take your order.  You have to walk to a window and order then go back to your seat with a pager.

w9iVvcenI9a7hoB-y4eLTw.text: We went to the Beerhaus on February 25, 2017 before a concert at the T-Mobile arena. It was happy hour- but still somehow we raked up a $500 tab of mostly Bud Lites and Miller Lites.  The food,  you have to order it from another counter in the restaurant and pay for it there - your waitress won't take your food order.  It is kinda limited to French fries, soft pretzel bites, and deep fried pickles. So it's separate from your liquor tab.  The place is called beerhaus- but sorry we are out of that and that is only available in a can- oh and that beer is only available in a can too.  Give me a glass to pour it in then-out comes a plastic cup- which is not terrible -but still. I expected so much better.  This place won't last - I will put in a futures bet on it.  Just imagine if the place was better managed and the selection was up to snuff on a concert night?  The place was 3/4 full - I would think it could be busy crazy- because next door is a CPK!!  They are sitting on a gold mine - but they act like it'll just pay for itself.   It's a no brainer- Drinks and stuff before a concert?? -I'd be doing promotions - have the Miller or Corona swimsuit girls be pouring drinks and giving out free stuff - and making Bank!!! Too easy!!!

taeIyZ9KHTrC8HHRwCJ6tw.text: We have thoroughly enjoyed the quality of food and hospitality.  Wait staff was very friendly and did a great job.  Food was very good.  Happy Hour was outstanding for Las Vegas.

NYe06XaPjFAoDTn_FqdE7g.text: Loved this place.  Good chicken and pork sandwiches and lots of choices for beer, TV'S and cool music.  Our server was great (Shelby) and the manager came over to chat with us (not typical in Vegas).  This will be a regular stopping point for us when we visit Vegas.

kBVsgo4DnL0-RARJBAt2kw.text: This by far my favorite beer garden. More than 20 drafts, local and sustainable food (beerhaus hotdog is my favorite), and a very authentic, lively vibe. One of my new local hangouts.

tqcPvIlJrUQCiUdfVU6T7w.text: Great concept and I would imagine if it's busy....the environment would be great. We came in on a slow night. Honestly for being a "beerhaus" I wasn't impressed with the beer selection. We played Connect 4 at our table. You can also play Jenga, corn hole, ping pong, shuffleboard, and several other games. Great location though right beside TMobile Arena and New York New York.

rmCJMkx6zkaWOMzlHr2PdQ.text: With so much to do and see in Vegas, why would someone go to the same place every day? To see Ageta of course! Ageta or Aggie as she like to be called is by far one of the of the best servers I have had in recent memory. All I had to do was order a beer once and she remembered for the rest of the week I was there. She is truly a standout in an industry where service has taken a back seat to volume. I can't wait to be back next year and as soon as I check into the hotel I will be off to the Beerhaus. The food is really good too. Nothing compliments a nice dogfish head 60 Minute IPA like some pretzels and fried pickles. Tuesday nights they have trivia which is a blast! If you are in Vegas, make sure a stop at the Beerhaus to see Aggie is on your todo list!

O-H2KuMpNEGtFWZdxW3Etw.text: Went here on a Saturday night with group of friends and it was super fun.  Pros-great service, nice selection of beers, very good bar food, lots of televisions and games. Good for mostly adults but saw some kids having fun too.   Cons-not that easy to get to. Parking at NYNY not that bad but signage to get there was pretty confusing.   Obviously the con won't be a problem next time so we'll definitely go back.

gYBSJsLeLg7TxDlNPDRpYg.text: We loved our experience at Beerhaus! It's off the beaten path but worth the trip. Great beers on tap and our waitress, Rubina, gave some great recommendations. We'll definitely return next time we're in Vegas!

33fCS-_bfKWMkvSsBSrnmg.text: Was not particularly impressed with Beer Haus in terms of beer or food selection. I tried to order a fruit beer on my visit and they were out. I felt the other selections on draft were fairly typical for local beer specialty places (Miller's Ale House, Aces & Ales, Yard House).I did like that they served food very late, but wasn't really impressed with the selection. I ordered a porchetta sandwich and I thought it was pretty greasy and bland. The fries were good, but the red velvet whoopie pie was gross. Took a bite, gave it to my friend who also took a bite and then we threw the rest out. Cool idea to have games available for people to play, but not enough to bring me back.

ahL2ntlan2xMDQjnt4bddw.text: We were so impressed with the service and the beer selection. I love trying local beers and Lovelady puts out an amazing beer! Every time I see pretzels on the menu I cannot say, no. This time Beerhaus did not disappoint, the beer cheese was phenomenal. Best atmosphere and prices on the strip! We will definitely return. Ambiance, beer selection, food, service, price and location are all reasons to make this part of your Vegas trip!!!

nyY0WUuawOv6OhQvTP3FFA.text: Pours a 12 Oz (cause it comes in a can) in a pint glass and calls it a happy hour. Happy hour only on 3 or 4 select beers. When asked they just say sorry.

Qjsp8Om_s2VHAvQ5jHIwxg.text: This place is so wonderful. Staff are very attentive and knowledgeable about their extensive beer selection.

k9pm3HQIVt9OOfhEFLLzfA.text: We are from Vancouver BC, Canada. Walked into BEERHAUS and Catherine M. Served us. Best service we experienced. She was amazing. The beer was great and food she recommended and amazing. But I didn't order the Beer Cheese Sauce and she was right it is amazing. We passed along this great info to the manager Joe and he was so happy to hear about how great Catherine was. Truly. If you are in VegasCatherine is a must see at BEERHAUS. The only reason we came back here was because of Catherine. We will be back every year because of her

mdyGJVTi3weTfwwYnB3dZQ.text: The best hanging out spot in Vegas!! Great food and amazing selection of craft beers! Staff represents everything that this industry is about!! They are friendly, prompt, knowledgeable and they know exactly how to have fun while entertaining others!!

8uswp8qlkwldHyjioLeYGQ.text: Amazing selection of craft beers and the service is top notch. Bartenders know their craft beers and can make recommendations based on your preferences. Food service was super fast too. This place NEEDS to be a priority on your places to visit if you are in Vegas.  Make sure to give yourself a few hours to taste the wide selection of beers.

m-U8aeI2fk_yL8OYki4UVQ.text: We had fun at happy hour. Truth or dare Jenga and corn hole with great beers. Fun place would go again.

Pl8pGqQ9IfRSEmAACQogUg.text: I haven't eaten here, but I enjoyed the extensive beer menu. Of course the first two I ordered weren't actually available, but that's probably because they just opened and ran out of some of the less common stuff. There were still plenty of beers to pique my interest, and the atmosphere is cool. Kinda industrial inside, kinda park-y out. Prices are in line with a new venue on the Strip...that is, high. I wouldn't make a special trip, but if I'm out in the area or at a concert, this is a good stop.

g-oJ6SPhXh89M8sCRE5YoQ.text: Went here for dinner had the chicken and potatoes, the chicken was a little rubbery and the potatoes were laying in a pool of grease so did not eat them. My wife had ribs that to me had a very bland taste. We were here last year and enjoyed the food but not this year. My wife's fries we full of grease also.

5D9VfDZSMotGXjO5pqtLSw.text: Excellent service.   Great drink selection.  Excellent service.  Food was on point, bartenders knowledgeable, live music, nice breeze, great place to get out of the casinos, did I mention excellent service

EniIif5DHgOUSA_TOO4-2A.text: I've never been to a brew pub before where if you sit at the bar - the bartender doesn't take your food order. You have to get up and place your food order at another part of the restaurant after you place your drink order. I'm not a fan of this concept. It took about five minutes and three bartenders looking my way before anyone asked for my order. If you want a cold beer it's fine otherwise go next door.  Service 2/5 Food. 3/5 Ambience 4/5

N7TxKF7apoTdhdM2IunY1w.text: Beerhaus is a good location for happy hour if you're looking to drink. The food options during happy hour are lackluster but the menu has a decent amount of options. There were 4 options for beers during HH and we enjoyed the ones we chose. My husband wanted to watch the USA soccer game and the staff was very accommodating in changing the TV station. The service was excellent and we'd come back again.

v96Sobcky8W8Mn5oPf8ETw.text: Well Below Expectations  Our first trip and probably our last.  This place has the choice of a BIG THREE beers on tap!   The sausages were mediocre at best.  I've made better hot dogs at home.  As you can imagine, very hard to get a seat if you want to actually eat your meal sitting down.  Even though they advertise Happy Hour 4-6, we were there at 5:30 and they wouldn't honor Happy Hour pricing.  Instead, we were charged $9.00 a beer.  I don't think so!  They are in NO WAY a " Beerhaus" with a whopping 3 beers and few sausages.  If you're looking GREAT BEER AND SAUSAGES go to the Haufbrau House.    Typical tourist place but, a local will go elsewhere.

GbGmHDHWsPBeYTwm_wjtxw.text: Servers only serve drinks so if you're hungry, you'll have to go to the order window and wait til the buzzer goes off to pick your food.  Food menu is also very limited and while it's not too bad, I wish they had a healthier option.    It's great fun whether with a crowd or on a date.... play Jenga, ping pong, and a few other games provided.    Looking forward to going back to enjoy more Jenga!

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo Jenga!!

ABmH6ii46Z3dpS2QhUhGKA.text: ( Different ) that's my word for this bar/restaurant .  So I was told their goal is for us to have fun and just chill at our both or table but..... The servers just serve you drinks if you want food you have to stop what you doing (chilling) and go to a fast food window looking bar where you order your food then they give you a buzzer so when it's ready you stop "chilling" and go get it yourself.   The food was good the place is cool but if the want you to "chill" and have fun the servers should bring you your food not just your drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XK4neOEB74l2C80gJwFXkg.text: We're back at Beerhaus again for our annual Vegas trip. They have a fantastic beer selection of local brews and tasty munchies to pair with them. So glad they're close by in our hotel!

VBZGdK6IjQY23Nb4_EaYNA.text: The Reuben was good, but the $6 onion rings were cooked to death. The place was empty but it took quite a while to get my food. Try elsewhere.

5KAECJKKHh3o5m-l20sGOA.text: Don't, just don't. Expensive, Unorganized Chaos. Won't do it again. $10 beers, bad service, order window for food, was told they would deliver to the table which they didn't. ice cold food that we had to go pick up and had to have remade. AND then they gave us the wrong food.

ihxAnVKbDTsydbmsUhOymg.text: OMG  VEGAN hot dogs on the Vegas strip!!!  Life is hard for a vegan on the strip but thankfully places like Wynn, SLS, and the MGM are getting hip to la vida vegan.  Dog is very simple but tasty. You can get basic dog or chipotle dog. I'm not a fan of spice but I got the chipotle anyway and it was delish.   Love the decor, the atmosphere, and you can also bring all your non vegan friends to enjoy a traditional German style dogs with imported beers.   It's not gourmet vegan but it's def a great option to have.

4L6GdCkiVqKNl_qGumHwXw.text: It's a shame I discovered this place within the last few hours of my first trip to Vegas.   The HH is legit. $4 for select pints and $4 for select hot dogs and brats at the food counter. Everything was great! Beautiful space, communal seating, huge wrap around bar, floor to ceiling windows that made it look even bigger and games spread throughout. There was also a space for a band.   The icing on the cake however was the service. Our bartender was incredibly friendly and genuine and paid close attention to our beer levels without hovering or pressing.   It's doubtful that I'll return to Vegas only because it wasn't my scene, but if I do, I'll definitely make a routine visit.

7yuBB4Wf5eCHgMp5A2LKeA.text: Not going to lie, I had a great time here. The bar area wasn't packed and the server/bartender was friendly and courteous. I was able to order my beer and food with ease and it came out fairly quick. The pricing may be a bit higher for a hot dog/beer place. I ordered one blonde, pretzel bites, and a bratwurst (lol I think that's what they're called) and it totaled about $32 with tip. The food wasn't bad; it was just wow for that price. Beer was hoppy because it was that one brand with the rock fish on it, pretzel bites were delicious with the cheese sauce and it's saltiness, and the bratwurst had a great taste and very juicy but I still had to add a bit of ketchup and mustard. Besides the food, the place had lots of room, lots of games to play with friends, and even a live band at times. Your best bet is to walk to this place or Lyft it because if you self park, it would have to be at New York New York or the Monte Carlo (aka the Park MGM) and they charge for self parking.

U9MdqptWKJt0ymMSJnG4cQ.text: The wait staff was extremely slow. When ordering they did know how much the drinks were because for some reason they were not all on the menu . I feel like you really need to check your bill to be sure you're charged appropriately. My beverage was higher then I understood it to be . I appreciated that they corrected it ,but was disappointed it happened in the first place. I went there when they first opened lots of table games it was  fun to hang out with your friends this last trip most of the table games were broken.  On the plus side it is fun when they have had the  table games to play with,it's can be relaxing  to have a conversation and not play with just your phone. . I do hope in the future they fix their games  and service . But if you're there for a quick service I say check out another place for now.

wya2hjfgaDMf9kQbdeipdg.text: Note to Self: don't bother going back Food: Luke warm and salty  Service: junk - told that beverage service was at table but no one ever approached our table; they did go to others around us, though. Misc: had connect 4 game on the table

V4JQi89aSva07d6DzODncA.text: Wonderful restaurant. We ordered the rib dinner, and the ribs FELL OFF the bone, most amazing ribs and BBQ sauce mix I have ever tasted in my entire life. Amazingly incredible service. Wonderful staff and great menu selection.

snUZOyxeZmZFN7bwavz5ww.text: Rachel is freaking awesome. Very polite and inviting. I really like the selection of beer here. Great spot to pregame before the knights.

IG8-9zo57p5ljwXY1YQfzQ.text: Service was good considering you order your food at a counter and they bring it to you promptly . Braut was okay...nothing special.  Try to catch happy hour as they are "worth" the $4-$5 that you'll pay during happy hour, versus double during regular hours.  Now please explain to me why ONE DELIRIUM TREMENS in a GOBLET is $15?  $18 with the TIP!  WON'T BE RETURNING!  I'm not cheap, but don't like getting screwed...

aIuvQXTMu2L4OjxV5Eg6OQ.text: Overall, it's a nice hip places for locals and tourist alike! They have a wide selection in beer, especially local craft beer. Although it's called Beer Haus, there isn't any food thats authentically German. Regardless, it's worth checking out! The bartenders are extremely nice :)

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ordered a flight of beer, 4 for 14 dollars. Not too bad considering its on the strip!

bQdBtieMg6ZwGRUsiijwuA.text: We just visited this place for my sons 21st Birthday and it was amazing! The female manager on staff was so accommodating and even changed the sports channel for my husband. The front was so nice when they took our order and even brought condiments to our table with our order. They have fun board games and a fun atmosphere. The food was yummy, I recommend the beer cheese and the Cobb salad I had was delicious!

wyDM_vE9p4AwXXdFZouHUg.text: A German restaurant that is right next to the T-mobile arena which has a lot of televisions and seats for a great sports night. I ordered a sausage and loaded tots but it took 30 minutes to actually receive my food so I felt that they could improve the rate food is served. The food itself was good and had a lot of flavor.   Food - 8/10 Cleanliness - 6/10 Staff - 6.5/10

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lb6uxGNCbYwuk_iO5p4CyA.text: A modern, large sports bar with plenty of screens, lots of local brews on tap, and some decent happy hour specials on apps too. Service is also fast, proactive, and professional, and the overall ambience is lively without being douchetastic.  There's plenty of room to spread out inside and out, and the location just steps away from T-Mobile Arena makes it perfect for pre- or post-game action. A welcome and apparently non-casino affiliated addition to the immediate area.

q9OHFNJmE2JP6zFl3Fqk1Q.text: Great Beer Selection!!! Great place to take a break while checking out the strip!! Will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Modelo &amp; Water!!

WGmPGo7zAYoJHHSwoQeXEw.text: I still truly adore this place just because they have a decent selection of board games and a huge selection of beer. However my visit this time fell a bit short.   There was only one waitress for the tables and she was busy (or just slow) and it took forever to get a refill on anything and we didn't get any water until right when we were about to leave. Food, however, was delivered quickly - we shared the loaded tots and they were delicious. Service at the food counter was quick and they were friendly.  It put a bad taste in my mouth when we went up to the bar to ask for a cup of water and the bartender looked at us straight in the eye then turned around and went to do something else. Not even a "hello, I'll be right with you" or anything. Just a bit rude.

r-VcpyJ1_706y07asxSI2w.text: We dropped in here on our way back to our hotel and this place was a gem! Seated outside and they were quick on bringing our orders, not to mention the bun wasn't your basic bun it was so crisp and fresh!

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pickled veggies

m3eRJsqltbiDOehTQ3RneQ.text: Looking for a place to watch the UFC fights and found this place on the strip. We got there around 5 and luckily secured a table for 4. Immediately after we got there the place started filling up. There's TVs everywhere so there's honestly no bad seat in this place. The beer selection was not as large as I hoped for, but it was decent. There's a small counter where you can order food. The menu changes, to my understanding. We ordered the Mac n cheese bites and those were delicious, also ordered other small bites.I even ordered a salad, which was ok. The service was not bad at all, our waitress was always checking on us (of course you had to purchase beer in order to have a seat while watching the fights). The place got packed but not overly packed which I liked. I'd definitely would come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eraOFA7grVzBN4asKBQOnw.text: Can't rate them higher! First, I wad told before ordering a beer that they service food.  Not totally True!  You have to walk upfront and order from another company.  I'd not have ordered knowing that.  Second,  the pricing is New York City! $9 - $15 for beers worth half that.  Third, beers are served in cheap plastic cups, which are both horrible for taste and environmentally unfriendly.  What did I like? Decent list of beers.  Pretty good service.  Lots of TVs to watch sports.  The lady serving me (Ana?) just talk a bit more with me and was really sweet (added a star for her)! Overall it's a solid beer and sport hangout if you'll a lot of money or drink a beer.  Beer menu will make most people happy.  I'm on the fence!

fANvmieQbEkm5CusE8748g.text: Hot dog! My cousin, Yvette, from Hawaii has retuned to the 9th island and is the beer tender!  I ended up there after the Knights hockey game and the house was full. I was at least four rows deep from the bar, however cuz found me in the sea of fans.   I went with the Beerhaus Brat, is smothered in house cheddarwurst, smoked bacon, and onion jam. Add fried pickles and I was set!  There's at least two dozen beers on tap. Even without enjoying suds, it's a crazy place. I couldn't really visit with my Ohana, but it's on my que for a future visit! Aloha, Yvette!

Japb16FBaqj2mVd_wgDHCg.text: We came in midday in Vegas on a day we were just walking about, for lunch.  If you sit at the bar, the bartender will order food for you, rather than having to get in line and order at the counter, which is weird in my opinion for the location, but I guess if you're just drinking beer and want to get a hot dog, it's more convenient than having servers milling about, and probably more affordable for the restaurant.    Craft Beers and Full Bar.  We got the Pretzel with Beer Cheese and the Beerhaus Brat, both were tasty!  Patrons at the bar were friendly and talkative, it's very close to the LV Knights arena, good location close to NYNY Hotel.  We've been in once before just for a drink.  Cool vibe.  We'd return, I am sure we will.

ZWDIaOl_g2sNX_wdsvEAKA.text: Fun place right off the Strip with lots of high bar-table seating, huge TVs for the game, and a phonebook of beers to choose from.  Great to see SW and Vegas local brews in addition to all the international options.  Menu isnt bad, I liked the choices for apps more than the entrees.

yYAFTjUjCuRK7Bd6dX33GA.text: Happy Hour 2-6pm Daily- No happy hour on event days  Happy hour specials are $4 select draft beer and $4 select munchies  Beerhaus is a regular stop for us when attending events at the arena and Park Theater.  It is a fun atmosphere.  Most nights they have live music.  There are tons of games to play, everything from board games to corn hole.  Plenty of seating inside and out.  When the weather is nice they open up one side of the building so it is all open air.  They are one of the few places that carries J.K.'s Scrumpy Cider one of my husbands favorites.  Beer is not really my jam.  Luckily Beerhaus has a full bar.    Ordering food has been a bit of a pain.  You wait in line in the back and order food then they bring it to you.  If it is busy good luck getting your food.  They can never find where the food goes even though they give you a number for the table.  They also got my order wrong.  I think that was because it was so loud the cashier couldn't hear me.  Food ok.  Not bad but not sure it is worth the trouble either.

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Mojito ($13) and J.K. Scrumpy Cider ($12)

FVXjAsPU7XX1vphahZlyJw.text: Stumbled in while waiting for a concert at park theater. It was cold outside and we figured we needed a little to drink to keep warm.   They have food at the eats counter but we headed straight to the bar and found a few empty seats. It was pretty packed inside. The bar is in a rectangle shape so you face everyone sitting around it. That kinda sucks but that's okay. We got beer and wine and I was shocked at how much local beers and IPAs they had. The wine list only had about 5 or 6 to choose from and there were a few cocktails to choose from. The place does have the name beer in it though, so it only makes since to have mostly beer, right?   Service was quick. There were lots of TVs and Golden Knights stuff everywhere. Outside they had propane heaters at the ends of the tables to keep warm. The location is great and you can get in and out real quick.

EuCbzyI29X0JhFtZfPh5kQ.text: I don't think you'll go wrong with the beer and food here. A large selection is available at this good gastro pub. I wish I could have had tried many beers but settled for a sampler, that's a flight I believe. Anyhow they were good.  Had the most expensive burger, because I don't recall the name, and the fries were pretty good. I really was surprised with those great fries.   Good time and good service.

oG8lj-n-wBl5MUE_zrZgqQ.text: Great beer from local breweries and beyond!!great location with a lot to do in the area. They have a nice outside area for hanging out!

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great beer from local breweries and beyond!!
Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy beer!!

I7rDp6PJ5MrpiTQUkqiTYA.text: Located right outside t mobile arena. Tickets for the golden knights was like $400 a person when you can drink some booze and watch big plasma tv with a fan overhead for $30 a head. The winner is clear hahaha. Just make sure to leave before the game ends at the arena otherwise you'll be stuck in 20,000 people traffic.   No happy hour when there's events. Servers are beautiful and attentive.

6sSWKcbrxtuv-y7XC40crg.text: We went for a anniversary party and the atmosphere was perfect! Upbeat, busy, and there was even love music by the end of the night. The French fries were so good, the green beans too. Burgers on point! I can remember the name of my drink... Tennessee something... and it was sooo good!! We will def be back!   PS- our server was a doll too! Very funny and tentative for such a large party!!

9Ss0xIfr36Lge8eKlgCRbA.text: I come to Vegas twice a year for fun and at least another dozen for work. Either way, I come to Beerhaus.  There's nothing special, but I know I exactly what to expect. Slightly below average cost for the area. Plenty of beer. Decent food. Enough TVs to stay busy. A beautiful outdoor area.   Then comes the special part. Super attentive and kind staff. I don't know if it's company culture, my luck, the hiring staff, or fear that puts smiles on their faces, but it works. Unlike other places, I can't go here without 3 different people checking in on me. Yes, your conversation might get interrupted, but your water will always be full and good luck getting 3/4 through your beer before they are checking to see if you need another. Also, you can't find bigger hockey fans in the desert. I don't mean customers, I mean the staff. I'm sure working steps away from T-Mobile Arena helps, but these guys know their stuff. I can talk hockey from 5-10 years ago and they know what's going on. It's probably all of that NHL Network they have playing constantly, but it's a huge draw for me. That said, NHL Network is on a TV at all times (probably not during Football games).   This is a great spot with great people and beers. So much so, that I didn't even steal the pint glass that so clearly was telling me to steal it!

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour
Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour
Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not this time, but someday, you will be my souvenir!

5yglnIsZCGKBNItc9b649g.text: What's not to love! Beer and awesome food! And it's the home of the Vegas Knights! So one, the venue. Amazing place right by the Park outside of New York New York and its open set up really takes advantage of the Vegas weather. Very chill, very sporty. They have a lot of spots perfect for photo ops as well, especially when its hockey season. They have the typical craft beer selections and pours were consistent so cant complain about that. Since we're here to watch the games we didnt order any of their entrees but definitely will be back for those.

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front of Beerhaus during hockey game night

_p0BN7lfxfgmC4LeqU_rMA.text: In Vegas for the first time and came in here for a beer and lunch.  Great selection of beers - both local, as well as other domestic and international lagers, IPAs and ales.  The food is awesome.  I had the chicken sandwich and some bacon loaded tater tots.  Both were scrummy!  Definitely recommend and I expect I'll be back before I move on to my next destination!

JxfZriOG8-arWspymsbl2Q.text: I have worked in the industry for 8 years. I came here with a friend saying it's a fun local place. The beer was great but the service wasn't. We sat at the bar for a bachelor party but we couldn't get help. We noticed 4-5 bartenders all chatting and on their phones. We literally waved our arms to get any attention. At one point 3 of us wanted beer and we waved at a bartender and he went to the guy next to us because he knew him.   Overall, beer was great but no reason we need to flag bartenders away from their phones and group chats.

rmxyjs8fUc-myGlOcTCZUw.text: Convenient stop close to T-mobile arena. Typical crowded bar near a sporting event. Special lower beer prices on selected brands on game day. I felt that $4.00 was a good value for IPA draft. I had the shaved beef with horseradish sandwich, which was ample size and tasty. Probably the best place to go before an event at T-mobile for a few quick drinks.

vE8ssUyg6A8vru9W7W4iTg.text: I came here after a concert at the T-Mobile Arena and they have great happy hour deals at night! They had many menu items for $4. I tried the burger and the pretzels, both of which were really good. I also had a beer, although I forgot the name of it, was very hoppy. They have a large selection of beer so you will have no problem a drink of your choice.  They also have large jenga sets and small jenga sets you can play with as you drink your beer and eat your meal. It kept us entertained for a while.  They also have live music at night, or at least on Saturday nights they do. It was enjoyable to listen to.  Very cool place to check out in you're in the Park Area of LV.

bnO4BxSRzju8vIxBONmwhg.text: Came here for the first time and was so excited to see a vegan dog on the menu. Ordered it and was served the non-vegan version. Whether on purpose or by accident, not something I'm interested in finding out or coming back to repeat. Be careful out there, folks.

tcPYYFkzOvHrckpos8C60w.text: I love the vibe and atmosphere of this place. It's all wood and modern, with a touch of country feel. There's plenty of seating around the bar, as well as some booths, high tops, and regular tables. There's also bench / picnic table seating outside. It's very open allowing you to see and hear all the action happening outside. The beer list is lengthy. They have a great variety of beers on draft, as well as in bottles and cans. They also have some wines and cocktails too. The prices aren't cheap, but they aren't too bad either. And there's a happy hour, live music, and lots of games (Jenga anyone?). If you want food, you can order some at a little window. Sometimes the bartender or sever will put in the food order for you. The service is meh. The food is eh. The beer is fab. (Note: Whenever there's a show at the arena, they nix their happy hour and any specials.) (Tip: This spot is more fun when there's not an event happening at the arena.)

yRuG8qkP9zjKWANZO0-G9Q.text: Great Brats! Great beer and a tremendous selection. Reasonably priced and fun. Lots of TVs to watch your favorite team. The staff is excellent!!

iq3PyHCHmIK3WR_LZ8kH3Q.text: Great pregame hockey hang with extensive craft list. Indoor-outdoor flow pleasant. Service attentive. Only challenge is separate line needed to stand for food since no table ordering. Sort of takes 1-2 people from group out to go wait 20 minutes to order.

YZJmAuPDCobHkJBuePzl6w.text: I love hanging outside here pre and post Knights games but the bar service leaves a lot to be desired. I shouldn't have to stand at the bar for 10 minuets with 3 different bartenders looking at me and then they walk away, come back, and help someone else that just walked up. I have given up ordering at the bar. Much easier to get one from one of the pop up bars outside.

1NiySjid6ZaszxCjLOiueA.text: The 5 star is for the people at the register and the wait staff, the beer selection and the tasty dog - Not because they have the most dynamic menu - but because the few things they make they do it right.   They have a decent selection of beers on tap  (about 30) with double that in bottles. They could stand to carry all of the las vegas local brews and not just a few of them. Same for the bottles, but still they have Devil's Milk and Delirium so I'm happy :)  The atmosphere makes it NOT feel like it's vegas, with the trees outside and the live music and natural lighting, I feel like I could be at the Grove in LA or somewhere in Baton Rouge. They have corn hole and Jenga for the table and larger versions that are awesome to watch in slow motion fall to pieces. They have wooden Connect 4 as well as ping pong, it's all tasteful is respectable of even the finest of bros.   Cafeteria style ordering, so no waiters at the tables, but honestly the liquid diet can work pretty good here ;)  Enjoy!

ad6TNBUXed2Zui27mUJC8w.text: This review is just on the customer service as I didn't have a chance to try their food or beer (due to customer service or lack of).  We walked in after a walk at "The Park" and sat at the bar (since there was no hostess) we waited at the bar without any acknowledgement from the staff whatsoever. They seemed bothered for some reason? Anyhow, not our fault. We waited and never got asked anything. Shortly after, a couple arrived next to us and immediately got attended? Not only is that rude but unprofessional seeing as the bartender was right in front of us. We let that slide and waited a bit more and still did not get help! Not sure what their problem was but we left. Will not be coming back. Sad because it seems like a pretty decent place with good atmosphere. Customer service is everything.

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LpnI3htecx0VkjcF7M11Pw.text: A cool find next to the T-Mobile Arena! Only major dislike is that I got stuck paying $20.00 for parking at New York New York because there was an event going at the arena.   The menu is simple, which I like about the place. There is this weird ticket amount next to prices which I didn't understand and had to ask if cash/card was accepted, which it was. (I guess tickets can be bought from the cage lady, giving the place a carnival feel).   *Be warned that you can not order food from the bar and that the only alcohol at the food bar has is either Bud Light or a Citre. Kind of an odd concept having to wait in two different lines before being able to pick a seat.   The place is new so I'm sure they are still trying to figure things out but the line to order was long, waiting for the food took a while and there were plenty empty tables that just weren't cleaned up after with no waitress to be found. I'm sure once this place is open a little longer that they'll get it together.

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All this for $50.00

cD6-KP4EXdmSYiFmdjd8Ow.text: We stopped into the Beerhaus while walking through"The Park". There were 2 entrances, one closer the the T Moblie arena and 1 next to Sake Rok ( I think that's what it was?)  it was hectic and a little confusing since it was right before the Guns n Roses concert, it was pretty packed and there was no host/ess stand to seat you so we just walked right in, past the bar until we ran into the other entrance.  There was a little counter where you can order your food get assigned a buzzer and sit anywhere you can find a seat.  The only catch about ordering at this "window" is that you can only order the beer they had on tap at that particular area.  This included Citra Rye, not your father's root beer and one other I forget.   We order a beerhaus brat and an order of beer cheese pretzels which came up to about $14.  We then had to head over to the bar to order our beers.  I grabbed a table and waited for our buzzer to go off while the beers were being ordered.  For the beers we went with a Founders and a chocolate churro stout.  The Chocolate Churro stout was really good, but they are only allowed to fill the cup up about 3/4 up for this particular beer.  The food was A-Ok, the beer list had a good variety but a little pricey at costing about $22 for 2 beers, but at least the food came out pretty quick!  The Ambiance at the Beerhaus would be great for big parties, there's plenty of long tables and lots of games that you can play, ping pong, foosball, shuffle board and Jenga!  *Negative star for no toilet paper covers in the woman's restroom.  Not that it was empty, but there was no spot for any toilet seat covers at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0VDaS6tPc5FVyuQ4YkXLhQ.text: It says a German style beerhaus with German style wursts...No, No, No, never ever go there!  Only one or two German beers on the menu, and American hot dogs from Oscar Meyer!!!!  YUCK, YUCK and more YUCK!!!

ejlmCDB5Bvj1ABUq_wMoHw.text: Absolutely love this place! Lee and Melissa do above and beyond their jobs to accommodate for everyone. Food is great, drinks are good, no complaints!! Definitely continue to keep coming back here.

KB64zQK5u3jWZDtA4x9q0Q.text: I love this bar! It has a great mix of of traditional craft beer and some harder to find draft beers. I always came in to see the bartender Katie, but since she left. I come in to see Natalie!! The bar itself is amazing and the rest of the staff is awesome. I love this spot and the food is dope AF.

xS5G6s6zo03y7iObTwwAdA.text: My wife and I bought drinks. She went out for a cigarette and could not get back in. At least 30 people left after she did and she couldn't get back in the bar. So they pretty much stole my drink money. FYI it gets busy during sporting events....Wrist bands or stamps help.

li46U7dyk8v4VpSqExnYIA.text: This place is no good. It's impossible to get a drink, and during my last visit, they "closed the kitchen down." They claim they had to because they were over capacity (they definitely were - you couldn't move without getting a drink spilled on you) but you also legally (per LV city liquor laws) can't close a kitchen while you're serving alcohol. And it's certainly not a patron's fault that you let in too many people! Just bananas that we waited for hours to get a table to have the kitchen closed on us. When we asked the manager what was going on, she physically pushed my friend. I recommend both locals and tourists avoid this place - it's never been good enough for the prices or the long waits. It's only busy because of its convenience to T-Mobile Arena. Big thumbs down here.

4yBGy-g71ou-LgIGES_ymg.text: Understaffed, unprepared, management is ambivalent, they are simply resting on location to survive.

aBdjefNKSACBvCm9nsqeUg.text: A nice addition to the strip.  I always try to have some local beers where ever I go.  The beer selection is nice with some local beers on tap.  I usually do not rent a car in Vegas and mostly just walk everywhere from my hotel.  With this location, I do not have to go far to try some local beers.  It is not extensive but it is a lot better than what the hotel bars are offering.  Service is ok.  I stopped in a little after the lunch rush and the staff was laid back.  It is a little strange ordering food at the food window and drinks from the staff either at the bar or walking around taking drink orders.  They have several games you can play at the table and some table games to play.  When it is busy, I can see the lines being long to play.  They have make your own beer flights which is not mentioned on the menu.  I wish they would add it on.  Next time I will try some food.

V331eGAMXyr5RKufc8ZdTw.text: I enjoy the ambiance in this place but the service tonight was awful. My boyfriend and I sat at the bar. There was only two other couples present and three bartenders. We waited for 10 minutes while both of the women ignored us. The kicker was "Jesse" who acknowledged us but continued to polish glasses as if we had already been served. I usually come during the weekend when the place is packed and I have never had a bad experience.  The fact that the place was empty and I was treated in this manor appalling.

a81khePdUcKaYxhdhFXuLQ.text: Come on! Where in the USA do you find $4 pints of LOCAL Nevada craft beer!? You may find $5 happy hour Budweiser or "domestic" drafts elsewhere. But honestly local craft brewz are way better.   Plus we got hungry and we were surprised how fast they brought the food!   My kinda place even thou im not a vegas kinda guy.   Super low key kinda place! Ill be back!

F82hyV1oeWScjS8rkQs1XQ.text: We were staying at the Park and just wanted a fun, low-key lunch. We had walked past this place many of times so decided to stop in. I was excited to play the outdoor jenga on the tables.   You walk up and order at the front & pay for food. ...Then after you sit down, you can start to order drinks. Odd? Just me? I don't know. Seems odd to have two separate tabs at a restaurant - but whatever! It worked. I ordered a cute little cider from Sweden and it was delicious. We ordered the pretzels & chicken quesadilla. The pretzel & beer cheese sauce were my favorite!!!!!!   Tons of seating indoor & outdoor. Out door games. Good music & GREAT spot for people watching.   If you are looking for a low-key spot this is for you! The beer list is AMAZING! :) PS - our guy VANCE was awesome at getting our drinks out!

0YWjgdU15Djef8vhcPFlug.text: It is awesome, as a vegan, to find a place where I can go into with my non-veg husband and see Impossible Burger and vegan dogs. Top that off with cold beer on tap. Enjoyed. Came back next day for happy hour...the happy hour food menu has a hot dog and other meat options but NO vegan options. Why not a vegan dog? I paid $10 for a dried out veggie dog, when hubby gets his meat dog for $5.   This is directed to management: more and more people are going plant based, which is why your menu is veg friendly. Please include us in happy hour. My veggie dog that was $10 had obviously been sitting out for a long time, so a $5 price would have still been bad but a little more acceptable.   Service: awesome! Every employee was friendly and when I explained my issue, they said they would pass it on.

85ZDCWpyvhhluweK1Y81-A.text: Left a house full of beer to go to a Haus full of beer. Didn't regret it.  Beerhaus is a bar located roughly in the middle of The Park. You may know The Park better as the stretch of restaurants just outside New York New York, or the not-really-a-park strip between T-Mobile Arena and the upper-case Strip.  Normally, I wouldn't be caught dead on the Strip, but I met up with some friends on a quiet non-event Sunday afternoon for happy hour. I have that MGM-associated credit card that grants me free parking nearby when there isn't anything happening at T-Mobile Arena, so I had an easy stroll from the New York New York parking garage down an escalator, across a backstreet, and down the sidewalk. If you're not so fortunate, you may have to pay or consider free parking options such as at the Miracle Mile Shops (aka Planet Hollywood), followed by trams or lengthy walks.  Happy hour is 2-4pm daily here. We met up at 2pm sharp and were able to reap the benefits for as long as we could handle 'em. Select beers are $4 during happy hour, and I was surprised to learn that today's list was comprised solely of local options: the Las Vegas Lager by Big Dog's, the Amber by Sin City, the Gypsy Fade IPA by Tenaya Creek, and the Love Juice (a hazy IPA) by Lovelady. Of the two beers which I tried at Beerhaus, the Las Vegas Lager was actually far more flavorful despite filling the mass-market lager niche. The Sin City Amber felt lighter somehow and just wasn't very satisfying.  Although we had a server at our table for drinks, we had to trot over to the counter to order food. I tried a few of the happy hour bites (missing out on the not-as-shareable City Dog and Deviled Eggs), which were all priced at $5. The Loaded Tater Tots were my favorite, with crispy tots and plentiful cheese and sour cream. The bacon bits kinda necessitate fork usage, but that's fine. The Hand-Cut Fries and Beer Cheese had crispy but underseasoned fries with a creamy cheese dip, while the Fresh Chips and Onion Dip had very crispy chips with a nice onion dip.  I don't have much to say about event-day conditions or the entrees at Beerhaus, but happy hour was a great time. The service was timely and the A/C and TVs were functional, and the room felt spacious. I would felt comfortable returning for happy hour on non-event days if I were to receive another invitation to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clockwise from left: Loaded Tater Tots, Deviled Eggs, City Dog, Hand-Cut Fries and Beer Cheese. All $5 during happy hour.
Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Chips &amp; Onion Dip ($5 happy hour)

aRnbe8aMhcpwL-OeHhpE6Q.text: This is a nice causal spot to hangout with a group of friends while enjoying great food and drinks. Located within distance of T-Mobile arena, New York New York, and Park MGM, it is a conveniently close to everything. You can come chill before going to a game or seeing a concert. There are plenty of seatings both inside and outside. There are a plethora of tvs if you are trying to watch any sports events going on. The outside have mist machines to cool you off from the scorching sun. There are games for those who want to challenge each other.   We came here for happy hour which is from 2pm-4pm. They offer $5 bites and $4 beers on selected items. We ordered the city dog, loaded tater tots, hand-cut fries and beer cheese. The city dog is good and comes with spicy mustard, Krauts, and relish. The loaded tater tots is amazing! It comes with cheese, bacon, and sour cream. The fries are good too.   Overall, I would come back here to try other food and drinks here. They have a wide selection from local breweries and have rotating taps.

Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wUdeyw5i1w0sWezdwQxx_Q.text: It's in the middle of The Park so conveniently located between Park MGM and New York New York and near T-Mobile arena.  There's both indoor and outdoor seating.   Order in the front counter for food and then find a seat and they bring you your food.  Table service is provided for drinks only.  They have jenga at most of the tables to keep you entertained if you don't want to watch any of their big screen TVs.   Cool casual spot to hang out although cocktails are just as pricey as the hotels.   Food is bar food (brats, burgers, wings, fried foods) so nothing special but it's does the job and fills your belly and has lots of beer choices.

0_HhgWTIreQ0Hno_CFrQLQ.text: We rolled into town, unloaded our luggage and made a B-Line for a place to watch the Knights take down the San Jose Sharks. There was a good selection of places to watch the game, but we chose this place as the energy and vibe was great. We started off with a pulled pork sandwich that was very tender and delicious. The beer selection here is fair and they did have a few favorites and I decided on the Duet, from Alpine Brewing out of San Diego. Great beer!!!  We also tried their chicken wings that had a light, zesty buffalo sauce and tender chicken inside. Winner!!!   There were many TV's to watch the game and you could hear the goal horn 10 seconds before watching it on TV.  Pretty funny!!!    The only drawback with this place is the bright lights beaming from the ceiling that shined right into my eyes. Luckily, they were set on a timer and shut off about 20 minutes after the game started.   I think the draft beer list could use a bit of tweaking, but overall, a fun, high energy place to watch the game!!!

3_Jd0CklzmPT_aE3oN4HgQ.text: Only reason for 4 stars is the price. $5 for a soda and $10 for a hot dog. Awesome that they have vegan dogs, though! I got the vegan city dog and it was delicious. It's not a Field Roast sausage, which I don't like. They also have the Impossible burger. It's by the Park and the park theater. Good food!

8BoDICPebtczA13AZT8AYw.text: Discovered a new favorite place to eat at New York New York casino. Like that they have two vegan hot dog options (city dog and chipotle dog) as well as the impossible burger with vegan mayo and vegan cheese. The employee taking our order was friendly and food arrived to us quickly. I'll definitely eat here again next time I visit Vegas!

PtA0-T08LZPYCxganVkcGg.text: The atmosphere is fun and there is games right outside of the restaurant. It is located beautifully on the strip next to other restaurants & attractions. The food is good for a bar style. I enjoyed their pretzels & cheese as well as their wine. The vegan/vegetarian options are amazing! Great spot to try at night to enjoy the atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretzels, wine, soda

SXV8HAE0_aE2X5rLEL27PQ.text: Before heading to a VGK game at TMobile Arena, we wanted to grab a bite to eat.  It's attached to NY NY hotel for easy access on the outside.  They can hold many many dining and bar patrons or a fun atmosphere.    If you're there for food, there is a counter to place your order.  The menu is simple but they also offer vegan items for those with dietary specifications.  They give you a pager so the food runner can find whose order to deliver.  There is no need to go back up to the counter to retrieve it.   If it's drinks you're wanting, the abundant waitresses with happily take your drink orders from their expansive bar.    I ordered food this time and tried the bbq spit roast pork sandwich with fries.  The sandwich was a little dry and could've used more sauce but the meat did have a great flavor.  The side of fries were so full.  It was plenty for us to share and enjoy.    I think you might have better food options before a game but for a quick drink it's conveniently located in the strip action.

Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

nZfOYgIjSEz7zf50-Nkgcw.text: This place is great for hanging out and watching a sports game.    I have mixed feelings on it so I'll rank some items and summarize why I rated it as I did.    Food = 4 stars.  The food was hot, burgers and sandwiches where a good size and everything was fresh.    Service = 4 stars.  The server was pleasant.   Pricing = 3 stars.  Overall a decent value but not cheap.  It's Vegas in New York New York.  Ambience = 3.5 stars.  Plenty of TVs and it was clean.  But seemed like it was kind of dead at 9pm.   The biggest downside is that you order at a counter, pay and then sit down.  I'd rank it higher if they waited on the tables which is what this place should be in my opinion.  If I wanted to order and sit I'd go to A fast food joint.   Overall, good food but a fast food feel.    Enjoy!

3NOujt1b748R7iXvDr73wQ.text: Brats in Las Vegas...  On my way to the Golden Knights game (at the T-Mobile Arena), Beerhaus called out to me.  A couple of my friends had dined there in the past, so it must be an ok place, right?  I strolled up to the cash register and ordered a Beerhaus Brat...it seemed to be topped with BBQ sauce and a few onion rings, but when I read the description, it's supposed to be smoked Bacon and onion jam... haha... The bun was sprinkled with poppy seeds and the Weiner's casing had a crunch!  While I was getting a beverage, my order was delivered to me. How did he find me and my blinking device?  Anyway, I sat outside at The Park because the place was packed! No worries because it was a cool January evening and the band, Status, was playing some good tunes!  This is a quick, great way to grab a snack before or after a hockey game. I'll be back!  Note: they also serve sides, dessert, and beer!

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beerhaus Brat
Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. On tap... wall decor

tm8_xTGUZmbbuaB9OzvF_Q.text: Gets really crowded on game days and prior to events. Make sure you order your food from the food line first. Before you find seating or head over to the bar area. Food takes a while. Don't be surprised if some of your food is cold and other parts of your order are hot. They actually seemed to get our salad way warm (kinda gross) but the pork sandwich was cold by the time we got it. The City Dog was really good though.   Decent beer selection but spotty service. One time we were there last playoffs (June 2018) when my beloved Washington Capitals won the Cup in Vegas ( yeah!! Let's Go Caps!) the wait staff refused to take our drink order and actually told me it was because I was cheering for the opposition. Yeah well that doesn't help get me a beer or convince customers to come back. We did give it another go this time out and they served us. Shocker!!   It's just okay. Bar food and bar drinks for before your hockey game at T-Mobile Arena. It's convenient and that's why people hang out there and pregame. The food is meh and the service is hit or miss.   Cheers hockey fans!

AW0PVBA3szRIiWEFLFopRQ.text: Beer is life! Cheers to love and good friends!  Came here on an extremely busy Saturday evening while the Vegas Golden Knights were playing next door at the T-Mobile Stadium. Inside Beerhaus, patrons were watching the live broadcast of it on TV and man, was this place loud and festive that night. Go Knights!  Do we wait to get seated? Hm, guess not. So we grabbed a couple of beer menus and found ourselves a table outside where it was cooler and a little quieter.   So basically, here's how it works. You order your drinks at the bar and take it to wherever you wanna sit. If you want food, there is another counter off to the side. Place your order there and they'll bring your grub to you.  I got the Beerhaus Brat. An IPA chedderwurst brat with smoked bacon and onion jam on it and a casing that had a nice snap to it! It was a great wiener! Lol! Happy now, Joycie?!  We also got some Fried Pickles and Handcut Fries with some Beer Cheese Dip too. Once again, good choices.  I came back a couple of days later to try the seasonal, Elysian Night Owl Pumpkin Ale that Kathy H. turned me on to, and hot damn! It's a great beer! This time I sat at the bar where the atmosphere was much different from a couple of nights prior. This is neither good or bad. Just sayin'.  Anyway, if you get the chance, I recommend you check this place out. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Elysian Pumpkin Ale! Great tasting beer!
Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beerhaus is located right next to Bruxie!
Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers!

LYpODlvDXT5SnAAJLkTGLg.text: Beerhaus: A German name for my stomach.  This place has some good beers and great brats! We ordered Hand-cut Fries & Beer Cheese Dip, Fried Pickles, two Beerhaus Brat, and a City Dog. For drinks, we ordered a Coronado Guava Islander, Dogfish Head 90 Minute IPA, and a Banger Morning Joe.  I wasn't expecting much from their brats but when I bit down on that brat, it bit back. What a snap! I'm not saying the Golden Knights won because of me that night but I'm pretty sure I moved some tectonic plates when I bit down on that sausage and assisted the hockey puck into the goal a few good times. You're welcome, Knights. And those fries! They were crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside, and the beer cheese stayed gooey even after it cooled. I also enjoyed their fried pickles which came in spears instead of the usual chips. And being so close to the arena, I felt like working out too so I was lifting weights 12oz. at a time... in the form of a can of Corona Guava Islander. My waifu Sheryl M. was impressed by the amount of reps I was doing with that tasty beer, haha!  All in all, it was a nice bite at The Park, the faux New York setting bringing a beautiful ambiance. Beers and brats with my waifu any day!  Note: Sheryl M. likes wieners for dinner.  :D

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coronado Guava Islander. I am digging this IPA!
Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried pickles! I love fried pickles!
Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hand-cut fries and beer cheese (not pictured is the cheese).

Uh7paFk5PJ4OWZUsN0MSTw.text: You have to go here at least once, just because it is near the T-Mobile and in a great location. Expect to spend at least 80.00 for 2 people! I ordered a roast beef sandwich which had an interesting horseradish coleslaw on it. It was a good sandwich. The French fries were excellent! I also love pickles, so I had to order the pickle basket. It had both sweet and dill pickles in it. Add a Sin City Amber to my order and it was $40.05! That's definitely a Vegas Strip Price for food! The fries are big enough to share between two people, so is the pickle basket. No, I won't share my beer. It was a hot day and we managed to find a table outside that was thankfully shaded by a large tree. This is a cool place to hang out. I really liked it here. It is just kind of expensive if you are on a budget, but every now and then, this  is a good one. I did post a photo of the menu and my receipt. I was charged $7.00 for both my pickle basket and my French fries, but the board and the menu both said they were $6.00. So unless they are recently changing the prices or up-charge during events, I was charged incorrectly. No, I didn't complain to anyone, it's just $2.00 and that's not going to make or break me.
