a7UhK3iolEVctKBM2wWN5w.text: Kelly at the beer house and the Natalie were all amazing these b****** knew how to keep up with our drinking and dealt with us amazingly! Totally would drink here again heart!

3_LSS0SA9__T_GIR-EdAfg.text: I love this place! Brewery atmosphere with a mix of Las Vegas. In perfect positioning to pre-game the Vegas Golden Knights game. I've been here a few times since moving here. My favorite waitress is Taryn, she is knowledgeable when it comes to the beer menu and has a bubbly personality. Would recommend to anyone looking for a good place to watch some sports and enjoy good beer with some delicious food.

qBIdq6C_1Il9bP5GrcnieQ.text: Food: meh, bland egg sandwich- I had to check there was actually "tomatillo" sauce on it, ok pork sandwich nothing to special   Drinks: big selection that will get bigger as they settle in  Service: meh, definitely a eat quick & grab a drink to go. many of the tables don't even have chairs.  Obviously it will be successful due to location but I'm not going out of my way to eat there again.  Conclusion: glorified fast food bar

GpdkbE4GelHtWtuFDO2q3Q.text: Great, low-key place with ample seating to hang out with friends!  Love all the games--ping pong, giant jenga and checkers. and more but these were all that we played. And there's no long wait for any of the games which is a plus.   And obviously, they have an ample selection of craft beers. They have a lot of seating both outdoors and indoors, although the servers were a bit on the slow side.   Food is ordered at the counter. We enjoyed our late night happy hour (only on a select food items). The pretzel was stale but the beer dip was amazing.   I think I still prefer Beer Park by Paris hotel given the view and good service. But if I were at the Park, Beerhaus it is.

6txHt0SH0O7V2Dcm6sz-ZQ.text: We came here before the UFC fight to get food and a drink thinking (incorrectly) it would be cheaper than the food/drinks inside T-Mobile. You walk in and order your food "McDonalds" style. I liked that option (quick and easy and doesn't require a server finding their way to your table). Food came out fast and was very good, but incredibly small portions. A simple french dip sandwich was (if I remember correctly) $12.00. It was small and more of an appetizer than a meal. But it was a good sammich. So why two stars? One star is for the food and one is for the "order before you go in" model. We then found a table near the bar. The restaurant was pretty dead - I guess it doesn't draw the crowds for UFC that a game might. Lots of open tables. That said, we couldn't get a drink. Servers running around all over the place, no one stopping by our table to take a drink order. I stood at the bar for five minutes and was completely ignored by the bartenders (and the bar was not busy). By the time we found a server and ordered drinks we were in for sticker shock. A double vodka and soda was $22.00. The same drink (and actually more of a generous pour) in the arena was $4.00 cheaper. The food inside the arena was a huge plate of food and about the same price as Beerhaus. My advice when going to T-Mobile? Skip the horrible service and small portions at Beerhaus and just get your drink (and food) on inside the arena.

1Fh8TIZC5rigoX5chGxiYw.text: Came down to check out The Park, the weather is amazing tonight and we decided to stop at Beerhaus. The girl bartenders were so friendly and explained the beer specials on draft we had pretzel fingers with beer cheese sauce it was great! They have only been open a week but it felt like a well established bar! Lisa the bartender I had actually met at my bar the week before and she remembered it was so nice, she is great and knows the menu very well! The blonde bartender, Kimmie, was so sweet also, she told us about the beers we tried and did samples of. Bonus about this bar is they have games! Connect 4 at the bar! Jenga and more! Check it out :) :)

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the beer!! Thanks Kimmie and Lisa!!
Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Connect 4!

9JmfW7MFHUchOQgB0rWFVQ.text: I love this place.  All too often Vegas is overpriced, poor quality food (I'm a former chef, I know a sub-Select steak when I eat one) accompanied by mainstream commercial beer choices.  Last visit I found Beerhaus via Yelp, and made my way there on my only free night this trip as well.  As I recall, the food was decent enough on my first trip, and both times the beers have been well picked (great selection).  Maybe a little pricey compared to home, but not for Vegas....  The bartenders have not been very talkative either time, but the music selection is always good, and I find myself Shazam'ing new discoveries several times each visit.  Great place.

_bJKqOZoO5QZoUw6cPj_uA.text: Food is what you would expect, delicious German styled food :) . Good beer selection, good environment. Met with some resistance about having 1 tv on a soccer match with 14 total the all on hockey. Rupert, the manager, was kind enough to find a solution.

qb4AefbsPxv6TUUUnDnyGg.text: Great beer selection, and a great staff! Affordable prices for a restaurant on the strip. Nice place to stop in when going to T Mobile arena.

Yv-FTPAGaIetzxvcVn7XXg.text: Found this place on a Friday night while walking back to hotel. I walked into the bar area and was immediately greeted by a lively waitress. The place was packed and the live band was great.   We ordered two hot links and a chili dog off the menu. The links were amazing, covered in onions and peppers. The chili dog was on point covered in a massive amount of chili,cheese and onions.   The overall time spent here was great. As we waited for our food we played Jenga and had a great time.

QHVB7xG86n8ZQE_Op7Dhmw.text: Checked out the new Beerhaus last night. It's fantastic. Has a great urban vibe. Made me forget I'm in the middle of the strip. The outdoor space in The Park is awesome - even played corn hole with our server Aggie! Quite a few local brews to choose from. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Beerhaus - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of local craft brews to choose from

oDUzNRb6fHDYmOW2onWPYw.text: This is an interesting concept however I'd like to see a few more selections not so genaric. A monthly or bimonthly rotation of your selections would be great. But my biggest issue is your staff they don't care their attitudes stink and it showed when no one greeted me no one asked me if I'd like to see a beer menu NO ONE PAID ATTENTION. The final straw was being over looked multiple times by multiple staff members. I recommend your bar to hundreds of people everytime there is an event at TMobile Arena and even days when there isn't anything going on. PLEASE fix this.

YKGIwQxot2hO7NuVlP9meQ.text: Have been in Vegas for the past week and have been to all the beer houses on the strip, by far this is the best. Great selection of local and national beers on draft and bottle. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful in your selection. It is NOT owned by INBev like the other down the road which sells their proprietary beers. This is place is located immediately behind the Monte Carlo in the Park and near the New York Casino. A definite place to check out and try. They have a small snack bar which sells  fries, pickles, chicken and bar food. They have goose ball, shuffle board, corn hole and other games to keep you occupied.

ObA7ewk7dhk1gXhrGKTIRw.text: Stood at the bar with $20 on the table and watched the bartender walk by me twice for that recognize me. Absolutely ridiculous.  I shouldn't have to flag somebody down or beg for service. I can spend my money somewhere else.

AY5EeC3JjCtPIGTn3aEmbA.text: This is a nice casual place to drop by for a few beers and a chicken sandwich.  The vibe is cool, the food is pretty good, and the beer selection is decent.  This was my third time eating there in the past year, and the experience has been pretty consistent.  I've had their chicken sandwich a couple of times, and a brat the other time - all in all pretty good food.  I've also had their local pickle side dish - that was average, nothing really special.  They should consider sprucing it up a bit, maybe add other pickled vegetables to make it more interesting.  It's actually not that expensive, considering it's on the strip.  It has indoor and outdoor seating, some games you can play, and cute waitresses.  The one thing I would like to see is more beers on tap since the place is called, "Beerhaus."    I'll definitely be back.

Fdd0CMVzNCFFFofa8mkZyg.text: Great beer selection and food.  Great location next to the new t mobile  arena and the park.  The bartenders Jeff and Shaun are awesome!!  Great selection of bar and board games while you're having a few drinks. Highly recommended!

_wzL078gH6nwu5KT3zxTKA.text: Awesome place for quality craft beer!! Cool atmosphere and bartenders are super cool Big up to Jeff the bartender!

oLOPmb-KMp8m9iHaHdts9A.text: Stopped in for a few craft beers! Beer and the beer list was great! Ambiance was also good. Didn't try the food though! A definite go to! Great place read beer.

k9DdmCSZ-5lMKdXQmvTi4Q.text: We have drank IAP all over the world. We are visiting Lad Vegas. Found the Beerhaus. Loved Jeff and the Alpine Duet IPA!

6iu8L5U-5tv3aSOUVBoqxA.text: Great selection of beer, great selection of sports, and the staff was very friendly! If you are there when Jeff and Cat are bartending, you will be setup for the entire time you are there. Definitely recommend!

bcCCsvJkuzMuEYkYTSBynQ.text: Sat at the bar and had to beg a waitress to wait on us. Ordered a beer I normally order and they only had it in a can. I felt like a 15 year old at a bonfire. Didn't ex0ect a canned beer at a nice establishment. Then she never asked if we wanted food or anything else.

7aZ2luuzf24f11rt5XYgNg.text: Amazing fun atmosphere. ...they have games and cool sounds. They carry local beers which is nice and a $4 draft happy hour. In cool weather they keep the doors open but have the heater cranked so it's comfortable and you can drink all day.

MX4y4IDKSLJKy9ZqzMpUUg.text: Went here Thursday afternoon for lunch with a co-worker. +1 Atmosphere, +1 Beer selection, +1 Good Concept, -2 Menu is simple but execution needs work.  Handcut fries were salted and good size but over cooked in too much grease, the chicken sandwich needed more arugula and crispy onions, and less mayo along with a smaller bun. The dessert "Bye-Felicia" was something I was looking forward to just because of the name! but a pre-made frozen ice cream sandwich needed time to thaw, and use better quality cookies and ice-cream.

wJhYghdT6PgCBNSbH_JX1g.text: We had a great time. The food was very good, we had the beer brat. But it was the service that stood out. Agata was awesome  she recommended great beers and I found my new favorite.  Dragon's milk. She was also very fun to talk with and made us all feel very welcome. She gets a 10+ with us.

g_44WQjGxLyLQV3c-wxRUA.text: For Vegas, this is as good as it gets.  Great beer selection and very good food, although a limited selection.  I'd give this a 4 1/2 if it were possible, as they could get a bit better.  Bartenders were quite knowledgeable and very friendly.  Comfortable bar that encourages interaction with the other out-of-town beer geeks that gather there.  Had Moody Chocolate Churro Beer out of Chicago, an incredible Banger Morning Joe (coffee kolsch) out of Vegas, and a Great Basin Outlaw milk stout our of Great Basin in Sparks.   Lots to choose from.  Spent parts of two afternoons there, which my lovely wife gambled.  Time well spent, and much less expensive that equivalent time spent gambling.

VqWl8CBTBf0560uDIxCrhg.text: Came during Happy Hour and there were some local brews on draft which is nice to see as someone who lives in Vegas. Shaun, our bartender, had great product knowledge and did not hesitate to make some recommendations for this indecisive gal. Also got the Free Range chicken sandwich and the pulled chicken meat was well seasoned and not too heavy for midday grub. All the way around lovely way to spend an afternoon or evening without the full crush of Strip craziness.
